lines.text: There's two dead women there... and two little kids. They scalped them all, all four of 'em. Bounty hunters. The government down here pays 200 pesos a head for men, 100 for women and 50 for those kids. They kill any Indian and then claim they are Apache. I don't see how any man can sink so low. Must be Texans... the lowest form of white man there is.
That was a great shot!
Not so great, I aim for his head.
"Once I moved about like the wind. Now I surrender and that is all."

[speaking in Apache]
I heard you were wearing the blue coat. I did not believe it. Now I know your heart.
1st. Lieutenant Charles B. Gatewood.

[speaking in Apache]
It is good to see the great warrior.

[speaking in Apache]
You speak pretty good Apache.
2nd Lieutenant Britton Davis, 6th Cavalry.
You are now under the protection of the United States Army.
That's more of a lynch mob than a posse. But if they serve those warrants, I'll have to give you up.
You have a good long glass, Gatewood. If I scare them off, we trade.

[narrating]
The federal government had forced over 500 Chiricahua to take up residence within Turkey Creek's narrow borders. Corn was the main crop, but the land was not fertile enough for them to be self-sufficient. The Chiricahua had become dependent upon monthly allotments of government supplies for their well-being
Gatewood. You come to visit me.
It makes my heart glad to see Geronimo. How's the life of a farmer?
Some Apaches are good farmer. Others miss the old way. I am not good farmer, Gatewood.
A lot of white-eyes want to see Geronimo hanged for murder.
Not murder. War. Many bad things happen in war.
How many white-eye did you kill since you left Turkey Creek?
Maybe fifty. Maybe more. How many Apaches do you kill?
You killed women and children.
So did you.
I just think you're a real sad case. You don't love who you're fighting for, and you don't hate who you're fighting against.
Perhaps I could learn to hate with the proper vigor from you, Al.
With all this land, why is there no room for the Apache? Why does the White-Eye want all land?
The Apache go where the best fight is. It's a moral value once you understand it.
No guns, No bullets could ever kill me. That was my power... Now my time is over.
I'm going to go on down to Tucson and I'm going to get drunk!
